feed.title: blank
feed.subtitle: Founded in 2024, AURA Lab advances AI for software engineering with a focus on transparency and resource‑efficient automation. Through disciplined engineering and real‑world validation, the lab turns research into dependable tools that improve everyday developer work. Led by Dr. Antonio Mastropaolo at William & Mary, the lab develops approaches in: Explainability & Interpretability -- methods that reveal how code models reason (rationales, traces, tests) so developers can inspect, trust, and debug automation. Efficiency & Resource‑Aware Automation -- quantization, distillation, and PEFT to deliver low‑latency, memory‑light, cost‑aware automation measured on real workloads with reproducible metrics. Multi‑Agent LLMs for SE -- role‑aligned agents that plan, code, test, and review, coordinated to produce coherent, end‑to‑end developer assistance. Neurosymbolic AI for SE -- hybrid pipelines pairing LLMs with program analysis and constraints to produce interpretable, checkable fixes, tests, and designs. Task‑Aware Code Automation -- from issues, diffs, and traces to concise summaries, TODOs, and plans; models that reduce developer toil with actionable, repo‑aware guidance.
